Posts.Content: gmccc1722 wrote: I am 38, had a mammogram that show microcalcifications that were suspicious.  To get a better pictures, I had to get another one that showed everything up close.  The technician took 2 pictures and said that if there were 5 or more, I would need to get a biopsy.  It did show 5 or more (not sure how many) and now I have to get a stereotactic biopsy.  I am so confused right now.  I have since learned about BIRAD ratings (ie:  6 to 8 is a BIRAD rating of 4, which is suspicious).  Can anyone shed light on this?  My head is spinning. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Microcalcifications, mammograms, biopsy, BIRAD rating gmccc1722 allvirgo71

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2009 12:57PM gmccc1722 wrote: TO:  Leaf Thank you for your reply.  The website was very helpful.  I realize now that I did not ask enough questions.   Knowing that they just said "5 or more", I don't know what that means so I will find out and then the website will be even more helpful. I prefer to be armed with knowledge.  Not to scare myself but to know what the doctors are saying.  Otherwise I am not in charge of what is going on. Will let you know how the biopsy goes.
